name: places/ChIJ3bRYUpFZwokRvN6bGIOhgQs
formattedAddress: 183 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002, USA
adrFormatAddress: 183 E Houston St, New York, NY 10002, USA

originalText.text:
I stopped by this spot while waiting for my shirt to be fixed at the tailor. I figured I would get my last meal in for night and wanted to sit down to have a bite. A spacious place and a friendly staff. First off, the lentil soup tasted magnificent. I wished the soup had some whole lentil in it. However, the flavors were definitely delightful. The bread was soft and good.
The lamb gyro, the lamb, could have been cooked a little more for my taste, and the seasoning was different for my overall liking. However, the ingredients were fresh, and I asked for more sauce.
The one they give you is not enough. Overall,  the soup and the bread were the high lights.

originalText.text:
Wow. Have to hand it to them. GREAT tasting & quality food at an amazingly fair price. Place is super clean (please keep it this way!) and staff is friendly.

Both of our dishes were delicious with the right attention paid to ingredient quality, prep, and cooking (grilled tomato a nice touch!) We will definitely return.

2024 update - have been a few times since the original review and consistently good. Went recently and had a chicken gyro sandwich. It was OUTSTANDING. I can’t believe they have actually gotten better over time. Plus now open 24 hours!!

originalText.text: The dolmas were ok. The babaganoush a bit bland, expected to taste the smoky taste eggplant acquires after roasting... the bread was good. The lamb and the salad were acceptable. I went expecting a bit more flavor.

text.text: The dolmas were ok. The babaganoush a bit bland, expected to taste the smoky taste eggplant acquires after roasting... the bread was good. The lamb and the salad were acceptable. I went expecting a bit more flavor.

originalText.text: I went there by accident, I had an hour of free time. The place is ok, there is enough space. There is no crowd that usually prevails in this city. The bathroom is very clean, which is noticed by many people. I ordered splitpea soup and fries, which I had been craving since the morning.  and fallafel. The last two were ok, no surprise, but the soup is really delicious and I highly recommend it. I regret that I don't eat meat on Fridays because I really wanted to try kebab in Turkish pita. It's not expensive, with tip it cost me 25 dollars

originalText.text: BEST BEST BEST !! Turkish cuisine I have tried so far in NYC!  Huge portions, affordable price, delicious food, clean environment. As a person who is fan of The Adana kebab. I definitely can say it was super juicy. I ordered double, and it was just enough for the delicious kebab. Well, falafel was a bit dry but the sauce came with it was really tasty. Although the chicken kebab was just a single portion, it was super big. Can’t wait to order double for next time. Definitely will came back.
